summary: "Only Fools and Horses" is a popular British TV comedy about the Trotter family, written by John Sullivan. It aired on BBC One from 1981 to 2003, with David Jason as the clever market trader Del Boy and Nicholas Lyndhurst as his brother Rodney. Set in London, the show follows their ups and downs, especially their get-rich schemes. It became very famous, winning many awards and being named Britain's best sitcom in 2004. The show introduced new characters over time and had a big impact on British culture, even adding new words to the language. It also led to spin-offs, like a musical in 2019.
title: Only Fools and Horses
